instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message: When the device came it was freezing at the apple logo. I tried 10 different bios. I cannot install an operating system, the bar does not progress. The operating system opens with another disk, but the operating system is not installed on it and sometimes it resets. When I try with SMC bypass mod, it comes to the setup screen, the error I get is as attached. I couldn't understand a strange problem

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message:
Did you try clean ME?
Can you log into USB test macOS?

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message:
I tried 4-5 clean me bios. And also i cant log into USB test MacOs. When I try, the bar does not progress and the device restarts. I have also observed that the CPU is overheating.


Can you log into USB test macOS?
Are you talking about a macos operating system running via usb?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201372[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message:
Yes, you must have at least 3 preinstalled USB macOS; in the same pendrive, or separate (better).

Try starting in diagnostic mode; let see if any error pops up.
Also try to boot disconnecting webcam and changing trackpad and LIO board/flex.

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message: The webcam cable is not plugged in, I tried it with another trackpad.

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message:
I heated the rams with solder flux and wrote back the original bios. Currently it does not give a memory error. I can come to the disk partitioning screen and start the installation, but it resets 9 minutes before the installation ends.
CPU heatsink temperature is 82 degrees, is this normal?

I tried with different disk. I tried with different wifi card. I tried with different trackpad. I tried with different IO board+ flex cable. I tried with different heatsink.

my problem could be the bios right now?

threads.title: 820-00165A A1466 No boot
threads.message:
Could be BIOS; try to clean ME region.

Also start with Live Windows/Linux, or Hirens and test the RAM.
